item.title: Outside Leyland, 16th December
item.description:
I am writing to report a council-planted tree outside 147 Haverstock Hill (in front of Leyland) in Belsize Park that appears not to be thriving and has remained largely dormant for several years (as shown in photo). Despite being planted some time ago, the tree has shown little to no growth year on year, which suggests that something may be wrong. There is also significant weed growth around the base, and the area often accumulates rubbish, which may be contributing to the problem. Given the length of time the tree has been in this condition, I would be grateful if the team could inspect the tree and consider replacing it if it is no longer viable. I also wanted to ask whether the base could be covered or treated in a similar way to the trees recently improved on Haverstock Hill, where weed growth and infection appears to have been better managed. That approach seems to be working well and may help prevent similar issues here in future. Please let me know if you need any further details from me. Thank you for your time and for your work maintaining Camdenâ€™s trees.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Haverstock Hill, Belsize Park, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet
